column4: my usb drive used to be working fine, automounted and could browse the files, suddenly it stopped working the regular way, I am not able to mount manually either.
my usb drive used to be working fine, automounted and could browse the files, suddenly it stopped working the regular way, I am not able to mount manually either

#1 It is a FAT32, #2 mount /dev/sdb /mnt/usb, it says unknown device, diskutility says no media. my usb drive used to be working fine, automounted and could browse the files, suddenly it stopped working the regular way, I am not able to mount manually either.

#1 It is a FAT32, #2 mount /dev/sdb /mnt/usb, it says unknown device, diskutility says no media. my usb drive used to be working fine, automounted and could browse the files, suddenly it stopped working the regular way, I am not able to mount manually either.

#1 It is a FAT32, #2 mount /dev/sdb /mnt/usb, it says unknown device, diskutility says no media. my usb drive used to be working fine, automounted and could browse the files, suddenly it stopped working the regular way, I am not able to mount manually either.  .i tried -t options, too.
but I ddnt notice any sdb# in /dev
gparted did not recognise sdb altogether.
if you have sdb and no sdb? then your usb drive does not have any filesystem
what is the output of "sudo fdisk -l" ?
- I have filesystem and was working fine. Suddenly I lost it. may be corrupted?
sudo fdisk -l should always list your usb unless it is physically damaged or the port you connect to went bad
but sudo fdisk -l cannot show any traces of your usb disk, that concerns me
but nautilus show it in the panel. saying 'Generic USB Flash Disk'.
I am not concered with gparted
can you please pastebin the output of sudo fdisk -l ? How much is the disk space of your usb disk?
